data.title: The Best Historical Fiction Books of 2023
data.meta_description: From tales set during the war to journeys spanning centuries, these are the top 2023 historical fiction books readers won't want to miss this year!
data.text:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”14268″ img_size=”full” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]Are you a fan of historical fiction books? If so, you’ll be in for a treat this year! 2023 is shaping up to be a fantastic year for fans of the genre. With new stories from some of our favorite authors and fresh faces debuting their first works, there’s something for everyone to enjoy. From tales set during the war to journeys through time spanning centuries, these are the top 2023 historical fiction books readers won’t want to miss.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”40px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”15478″ img_size=”full” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Best Historical Fiction Books of 2023

The Night Travelers by Armando Lucas Correa

The New Life by Tom Crewe

River Sing Me Home by Eleanor Shearer

The Little Wartime Library by Kate Thompson

Hang the Moon by Jeannette Walls

Two Wars and a Wedding by Lauren Willig

Homecoming by Kate Morton

The Lost Wife by Susanna Moore

The Disenchantment by Celia Bell

The House Is on Fire by Rachel Beanland

Only the Beautiful by Susan Meissner

The Secret Book of Flora Lea by Patti Callahan Henry

Good Night, Irene by Luis Alberto Urrea

Lady Tan’s Circle of Women by Lisa See

The Paris Daughter by Kristin Harmel

The Cherokee Rose by Tiya Miles

Loot by Tania James

The Spectacular by Fiona Davis

The Brightest Star by Gail Tsukiyama

The Romantic by William Boyd

Beyond the Door of No Return by David Diop, Translated by Sam Taylor

Queen Hereafter by Isabelle Schuler

The House of Doors by Tan Twan Eng

Let Us Descend by Jesmyn Ward

Above the Salt by Katherine Vaz

The Frozen River by Ariel Lawhon

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”40px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”14265″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Night Travelers by Armando Lucas Correa

Four generations of courageous women navigating love, loss, war, and hope from WWII Germany, the Cuban Revolution, and the Berlin wall’s fall.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The Night Travelers is one of the books in The 2023 Winter Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”14267″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The New Life by Tom Crewe

Two marriages, two forbidden love affairs, and two Englishmen searching for social and sexual freedom in 1890s England.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The New Life is one of the books in The 2023 Winter Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”14276″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

River Sing Me Home by Eleanor Shearer

A page-turning and redemptive story of a mother’s gripping journey across the Caribbean to find her stolen children in the aftermath of slavery.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”14266″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Little Wartime Library by Kate Thompson

An uplifting and inspiring novel based on the true story of a librarian who created an underground shelter during World War II.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The Little Wartime Library is one of the books in The 2023 Winter Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”14263″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Hang the Moon by Jeannette Walls

A riveting new novel about an indomitable young woman in Virginia during Prohibition.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Hang the Moon is one of the books in The 2023 Spring Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”15472″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Two Wars and a Wedding by Lauren Willig

From New York Times bestselling author Lauren Willig: a dramatic coming-of-age story with a dual timeline and a single heroine—a bold and adventuring young woman who finds herself caught up in two very different wars on both sides of the Atlantic.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Two Wars and a Wedding is one of the books in The 2023 Spring Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”15477″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Homecoming by Kate Morton

The highly anticipated new novel from the New York Times bestselling author of The Clockmaker’s Daughter, a sweeping saga with a thrilling mystery at its heart tracing a shocking crime whose effects echo across continents and generations.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”15476″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Lost Wife by Susanna Moore

From one of our most versatile, compelling, and sensual writers comes a searing, immersive novel about a seminal and shameful moment in America’s conquest of the West. Drawing partly from a true story, Susanna Moore brings to life a devastating Native American revolt and the woman caught in the middle of the conflict.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The Lost Wife is one of the books in The 2023 Spring Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”15475″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The House Is on Fire by Rachel Beanland

The author of Florence Adler Swims Forever returns with a masterful work of historical fiction about an incendiary tragedy that shocked a young nation and tore apart a community in a single night—told from the perspectives of four people whose actions during the inferno changed the course of history.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Listen to Rachel talk about The House Is on Fire on the podcast.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”15474″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Only the Beautiful by Susan Meissner

A heartrending story about a young mother’s fight to keep her daughter and the winds of fortune that tear them apart, by the USA Today bestselling author of The Nature of Fragile Things and The Last Year of the War.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”14264″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Disenchantment by Celia Bell

Set in 17th-century Paris, the novel follows a passionate love affair between two noblewomen who wish to free themselves from their repressive society, whatever the cost.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The Disenchantment is one of the books in The 2023 Summer Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”15473″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Secret Book of Flora Lea by Patti Callahan Henry

When a woman stumbles across a mysterious children’s book, long-held secrets about her missing sister and their childhood spent in the English countryside during World War II are revealed.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18632″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Good Night, Irene by Luis Alberto Urrea

What if a friendship forged on the front lines of war defines a life forever? In the tradition of The Nightingale and Transcription, a searing epic based on the magnificent and true story of heroic Red Cross women.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Good Night, Irene is one of the books selected for The 2023 Summer Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18633″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Lady Tan’s Circle of Women by Lisa See

The latest historical novel from New York Times bestselling author Lisa See, inspired by the true story of a woman physician from 15th-century China—perfect for fans of See’s classic Snowflower and the Secret Fan and The Island of Sea Women.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Lady Tan’s Circle of Women is one of the books selected for The 2023 Summer Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18631″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Paris Daughter by Kristin Harmel

From the bestselling author of the “heart-stopping tale of survival and heroism” (People) The Book of Lost Names comes a gripping historical novel about two mothers who must make unthinkable choices in the face of the Nazi occupation.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The Paris Daughter is one of the books selected for The 2023 Summer Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18630″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Cherokee Rose by Tiya Miles

Three women uncover the secrets of a Georgia plantation that embodies the intertwined histories of Indigenous and enslaved Black communities—the fascinating debut novel, inspired by a true story, of the National Book Award-winning and New York Times bestselling author of All That She Carried, now featuring a new introduction.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The Cherokee Rose is one of the books selected for The 2023 Summer Reading Guide.

Listen to Tiya Miles on the podcast.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18629″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Loot by Tania James

A spellbinding historical novel set in eighteenth-century India, England, and France, about a young man’s dream of leaving a mark on the world.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Loot is one of the books selected for The 2023 Summer Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18628″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Spectacular by Fiona Davis

New York Times bestselling author Fiona Davis transports us back to 1950s Manhattan and glamorous Radio City Music Hall in her thrilling new novel about a talented young Rockette and a mysterious bomber terrorizing New York City.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18627″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Brightest Star by Gail Tsukiyama

The beloved bestselling author of The Color of Air, Women of the Silk, and The Samurai’s Garden returns with this magnificent historical novel based on the life of the luminous, groundbreaking actress Anna May Wong—the first and only Asian American woman to gain movie stardom in the early days of Hollywood.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18626″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Romantic by William Boyd

From the award-winning, internationally best-selling author, a romp of a novel, at once intimate and panoramic, about the adventures and misadventures of a nineteenth-century everyman.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18625″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Beyond the Door of No Return by David Diop, Translated by Sam Taylor

Told in stories from the perspective of a French botanist in Senegal who becomes obsessed with finding a woman sold into slavery and escaped.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Beyond the Door of No Return is one of the books selected in The 2023 Fall Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18624″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Queen Hereafter by Isabelle Schuler

A suspenseful, sweeping historical epic for readers of Natalie Haynes and Madeline Miller, which boldly reimagines the origin story of the woman who inspired one of Shakespeare’s most iconic characters, Lady Macbeth.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18623″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The House of Doors by Tan Twan Eng

From the bestselling, Booker Prize-shortlisted author of The Garden of Evening Mists, a spellbinding novel about love and betrayal, colonialism and revolution, storytelling and redemption.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18635″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Let Us Descend by Jesmyn Ward

From Jesmyn Ward—the two-time National Book Award winner, youngest winner of the Library of Congress Prize for Fiction, and MacArthur Fellow—comes a haunting masterpiece, sure to be an instant classic, about an enslaved girl in the years before the Civil War.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Let Us Descend is one of the books selected in The 2023 Fall Reading Guide.

Let Us Descend was also an Oprah’s Book Club selection.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18622″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

Above the Salt by Katherine Vaz

An irresistible and sweeping love story that follows two Portuguese refugees who flee religious violence and reignite their budding romance in Civil-War America.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

Above the Salt is one of the books selected in The 2023 Fall Reading Guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”18634″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][vc_column_text]

The Frozen River by Ariel Lawhon

From the New York Times bestselling author of I Was Anastasia and Code Name Hélène comes a gripping historical mystery inspired by the life and diary of Martha Ballard, a renowned 18th-century midwife who investigates a shocking murder that unhinges her small community.

BUY ON AMAZON OR BOOKSHOP

The Frozen River is one of the books in The 2024 Winter Reading Guide.

The Frozen River is one the Good Morning America (GMA) Book Club selections.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

What do you think about this list of best historical fiction books of 2023?

Have you read any books from this list? What are your favorite 2023 historical fiction books? What 2023 historical fiction books would you add to the list? Let’s talk about all things historical fiction in the comments below.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image=”18636″ img_size=”large” alignment=”center”][/vc_column][/vc_row]
